results.title: Farnborough 1968
results.brief_description: Farnborough Air Show - 26th exhibition and flying display. Includes flight demonstrations and equipment and models on display. Aircraft includes Comet, Jetstream, BAC 1-11, Japanese Turbo Prop, Harrier Jet and many more.
results.description: Farnborough Air Show - 26th exhibition and flying display. Includes flight demonstrations and equipment and models on display. Aircraft includes Comet, Jetstream, BAC 1-11, Japanese Turbo Prop, Harrier Jet and many more.

results.title: Farnborough 1966
results.brief_description: The Farnborough Air Show features a large range of aircraft: airliners, executive craft, helicopters, military and private planes. For the first time European aircraft are also taking part, all powered by British engines. A great many missiles and aircraft components and accessories are on view, and there is a display of parachuting, gliding and aerobatics.

results.title: Farnborough 1960
results.brief_description: The 1960 annual show of the British aircraft industry, exhibiting the latest developments in aeronautical engineering and missiles. Among the main features were the Jindivik, a radio-controlled target plane, the hovercraft, the short sc.1 Vertical take-off research jet plane and among various new civil types, the Avro 748 airliner freighter. The flying display included team aerobatics by the famous “Black Arrows” Hunter jets of 111 squadron, R.A.F.

results.title: Farming with nature
results.brief_description: Tells the story of 70 year-old Missouri farmer Gene Poirot and his successful struggle to restore the fertility of a wornout prairie farm. Describes the ecological farming techniques developed by Poirot in the course of fifty years of observation of a natural grasslands ecosystem, drawing on methods from traditional and modern sources.

results.title: Farming in South China: Si River Valley
results.creator_credit: Victor Jurgens and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description: Rich river basin areas make good agricultural lands. In these densely populated areas, thousands of families live by intensive subsistence farming. Land is very scarce. Farm families in the Si River Valley do their own work with crude tools with rice being the dominant crop providing more food value per acre than other grain crops grown in the region. Poverty prevails among most of the population. However there still seems to be happiness among the people as they engage in the coninuous routine of tilling the soil and reaping scant harvests on which they manage to exist.

results.title: Farming for the future
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Collings, Shan Benson, Geoffrey Bell, Australian National Film Board and Shell Company of Australia
results.brief_description: The basic causes of wind and water erosion in Australia, and how in the Mallee areas wind erosion is being checked. Farming for the future means a new approach to old problems, since the farmers themselves suffer most from the effects of impoverished land.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Collings, Shan Benson, Geoffrey Bell, Australian National Film Board and Shell Company of Australia

results.title: Farm work: equipment maintenance. Ep. 4. Reconditioning a grain drill
results.creator_credit: Calvin Productions and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: Shows how those parts of the grain drill which are commonly subject to most wear are checked and repaired. Shows how to clean and lubricate the seeding mechanism; how to inspect and repair the disc furrow openers; how to inspect and clean the seed tubes; how to clean and repair the drive chain and sprockets; how to check the clutch and adjust the pressure springs; how to inspect and repair the drive wheel mechanism and how to calibrate the seeding mechanism.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Calvin Productions and United States. Office of Education

results.title: Farm work: equipment maintenance. Ep. 3. Reconditioning a two-bottom tractor plow
results.creator_credit: Calvin Productions and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: Shows how a tractor plough should be examined and repaired at the end of each ploughing season. Shows how to repair the front furrow wheel, the landslide wheel and the lift asembly; how to recondition the ploughshares; how to adjust the coulter; how to find the centre of resistance of the plough bottoms; establish the line of draft; and adjust the hitch; and how to mix the ingredients of the prime coat for painting farm machinery.

results.title: Farm work: equipment maintenance. Ep. 2. Reconditionog a mower (drive system)
results.creator_credit: Calvin Productions and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: How to remove, clean, lubricate and replace the wheel assembly; how to remove and replace the flywheel shaft and bearings; how to replace the wrist pin; how to disassemble, clean and replace gear assembly; how to lubricate the drive system.

results.title: Farm work: equipment maintenance. Ep. 1. Reconditioning a mower (cutter bar)
results.creator_credit: Calvin Productions and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: How to check and repair the cutter bar mechanism of the mower. How to remove and replace worn sections in the sickle; how to sharpen the sickle sections; how to replace and adjust the knife clips and wearing plates; how to align the ledger plates; how to adjust the cutter bar for proper lead; how to adjust the sickle for register.
